page.title: 04TANGIER FARM-BEEF MANAGEMENT
page.content: The management of beef farming begins in early Spring when the calves are bought at the market at about a week old. Initially they are fed on milk powder for two to three months before being introduced to dry cow-cake, cereals and hay. At about 6 months old they begin grazing on the open fileds, initially on the hay pasture. In the Autumn the maize fields are grazed and in the Winter they are fed on hay and silage. Within the year, the animals are sold off. Some are slaughtered at the end of the Summer others are sold later for calving and dairying.
